0:
```json
{
  "Model_Purpose": {
    "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms as an extension of a previous model. The model is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption. It examines the role that networked elites have in diffusing a non-punishment-enforced norm through an artificial society. The model considers norm advocates who promote a norm of humanitarianism, elites who have wide networks to spread the new norm, and general individuals who evaluate the norm pushed from elites and adopted by their peers.",
    "research_questions": [
      "How do humanitarian norms that lack associated punishments for non-compliance diffuse across society?",
      "What role do elites play in the diffusion of social norms of humanitarianism?",
      "How does peer pressure influence norm adoption in the absence of formal sanctions?"
    ],
    "system_boundaries": [
      "The model includes three types of agents: ordinary people, elites with social influence, and advocates who promote humanitarian norms.",
      "The simulation environment allows agents to interact one-on-one and assess the norm adoption of those who are near them."
    ],
    "outcome_variables": {
      "percent_elites": "Percentage of population who are elites (influencers)",
      "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values",
      "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents",
      "network_size": "Randomized size of network of ‘followers’ of elites",
      "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents",
      "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption",
      "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent",
      "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents",
      "percent_advocates": "Percentage of agent population who are advocates who promote a norm",
      "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents’ humanitarianism values",
      "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, to represent donor/compassion fatigue"
    }
  }
}
```

3:
```json
{
  "Model_Purpose": {
    "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms as an extension of a previous model. This model is not yet at a stage where we are prepared to verify and validate the model, so we instead performed diagnostics on the model using the ANTS algorithms to look for anomalies across the parameter space. The diagnostics did not indicate problems with the current prototype model that produce erratic results or unexplained outcomes. Future iterations of the model will look to more robust methods of verification and validation. The current model, founded predominantly on norm diffusion theory, is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption.",
    "research_questions": [
      "How do elites influence the diffusion of social norms of humanitarianism?",
      "What role does peer pressure play in the adoption of norms without punishment?",
      "How does the interaction between advocates, elites, and the general population affect norm adoption?"
    ],
```
